programme.title: 'Going undiagnosed' due to gender bias Nuclear Narnia London's toxic school runs
programme.desc: Thousands of autistic girls and women 'going undiagnosed' due to gender bias Nuclear Narnia: why is Sellafield Europe's most dangerous industrial site? London's toxic school runs: how polluted is the air children breathe.

programme.title: The Gene Gap: Should we edit our DNA? An imagined future of gene editing
programme.desc: There are decisions being made right now that could have an effect on global populations for generations to come. As part of this project, we commissioned an artist to investigate some of the themes raised in the podcasts.

programme.title: The secret world of Asian drag queens Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy
programme.desc: Getting rid of the beard is a challenge: the secret world of Asian drag queens Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy.

programme.title: Human animal
programme.desc: A series of videos looking at our evolving relationship with other animals.

programme.title: The art of photography
programme.desc: Guardian Australia and photographers across various disciplines take us through their process.

programme.title: America's Dirty Divide
programme.desc: How heat is radically altering Americans' lives before they're even born Baltimore is burning trash, so we're starving the fire.

programme.title: Why
programme.desc: Why Bitcoin is so bad for the planet Why we are all attracted to conspiracy theories.

programme.title: Blood, sweat and fears: special report on abuse towards grassroots football referees
programme.desc: The FA has rebooted its Respect Campaign this season to protect grassroots referees in England but many continue to suffer both mental and physical abuse.

programme.title: Can women save sumo? The crossroads facing Japan's national sport
programme.desc: The ancient Japanese sport of sumo is in well-documented crisis. Years of controversy and scandal have hurt the sport's ability to attract new talent.

programme.title: Desert Fire
programme.desc: Football’s world cup for unrecognised territories is viewed through the eyes of the manager and players of one of the most fascinating teams, Iraqi Kurdistan.

programme.title: Crannog
programme.desc: Alexis has a life-threatening disease. She spends her time in the wooded expanse of northern Scotland, where she takes care of dozens of animals who are also sick, wounded or dying.

programme.title: Is my neighbourhood poisoning me? Living in the shadow of a gasworks redevelopment
programme.desc: Since 2016 residents in Southall have questioned whether the gases released from the redevelopment of an old gasworks site could be damaging their health.

programme.title: David Bowie remembered by two of his biggest fans Free improvisation in underground music
programme.desc: David Bowie remembered by two of his biggest fans Free improvisation: still the ultimate in underground music.

programme.title: Abortion in Mexico The women protesting Poland's new abortion law
programme.desc: Abortion in Mexico: Catholics, the law and the right to choose 'Sex is not a crime': the women protesting Poland's new abortion law.

programme.title: Untold Chaos: Living through Libya's wars
programme.desc: At the end of his US presidency, Barack Obama said his worst mistake was failing to plan for the day after the intervention in Libya.

programme.title: The pig superbug and the baby
programme.desc: How did the antibiotic resistant pig superbug LA-MRSA find its way onto the umbilical cords of new born babies in Glasgow - and onto the shelves of our biggest supermarkets.

programme.title: The 'Lost Rambos' of Papua New Guinea: how weapons and Hollywood changed tribal disputes
programme.desc: Tribal fighting has long been present in the Papua New Guinea highlands but the influx of modern automatic weaponry in the 1990s turned local disputes into lethal exchanges that threatened to permanently reshape highlands culture.

programme.title: Fukushima: 'Nuclear power and humans cannot coexist' Toll on Argentina's indigenous people
programme.desc: Fukushima: 'Nuclear power and humans cannot coexist' How fracking is taking its toll on Argentina's indigenous people.

programme.title: Garth Nix answers your questions: on JRR Tolkien, gaming and pronouncing characters' names
programme.desc: In an ongoing series, Guardian Australia is getting kids and young adults to do the hard work instead of us – by interviewing their favourite authors.

programme.title: Skyward: birdwatching is belonging for two teenage conservationists
programme.desc: Young birdwatchers Mya and Arjun feel the pressure of climate breakdown and the biodiversity crisis. As two reserved teenagers on the cusp of adulthood, they find comfort in birdwatching while being distant from their peers.

programme.title: 2:22 Il destino e' gia' scritto

programme.title: L'albero della vita
programme.desc: Un uomo cerca di salvare la donna che ama e al tempo stesso di trovare l’Albero della Vita, fonte di eterna giovinezza. Le avventure dei protagonisti si svolgeranno in tre epoche diverse.

programme.title: Project Legion
programme.desc: Un ex marine si rende conto che, all'esterno, iniziano a verificarsi strani fenomeni. Improvvisamente, fuori dall'ingresso del suo appartamento, arriva un gruppo di zombie intenzionato ad entrare e l'uomo resta intrappolato nella sua abitazione.

programme.title: Vortex
programme.desc: Nel prossimo futuro i tassi di criminalità sono ai massimi storici. Il governo contrasta questo sviluppo con una nuova prigione: The Vortex.

programme.title: Universal Soldier: Il giorno del giudizio
programme.desc: John si risveglia in ospedale dopo un coma durato nove mesi. Gli unici suoi ricordi prima del ricovero sono quelli dell'omicidio della moglie e della figlia da parte di Luc Deveraux. John viene a sapere che Deveraux si è nascosto con un gruppo di fedelissimi in un bunker sotterraneo.

programme.title: Cyber Bride
programme.desc: Dopo che sua moglie muore tragicamente, un marito vedovo disperato trova un servizio online che può riportarla indietro - Ma non tutto è come sembra.

programme.title: Life like
programme.desc: James e Sophie si trasferiscono in periferia. Sophie decide di licenziare il personale di servizio. James la convince a sostituirlo con un androide e lei sceglie Henry. Tutto sembra perfetto finché il cervello di Henry evolve, incominciando a provare emozioni.

programme.title: Virtual Revolution
programme.desc: 2047. Parte della popolazione vive connessa a mondi virtuali creati da alcune corporazioni dove è possibile vivere senza dolore. I pochi del mondo reale vivono nella miseria di baraccopoli degradate o nella ricchezza del nuovo distretto.

programme.title: Sharknado 3
programme.desc: Nell'estate del 2015 uscirà il terzo capitolo di Sharknado, ambientato tra Washington D.C. e Orlando, Florida.

programme.desc: In una società futuristica in cui l’umanità ha scelto di annullare tutte le differenze tra le persone al fine di evitare conflitti dilanianti, la vita scorre tranquilla e asettica.

programme.title: Gantz Revolution - Conflitto finale
programme.desc: Due amici rinascono a nuova vita dopo un incidente mortale nella metropolitana: si risvegliano in un appartamento spoglio di Tokyo assieme a un gruppo di persone nella stessa situazione..

programme.title: Project Legion

programme.desc: Un virus ha decimato il genere umano. I pochi sopravvissuti hanno trovato rifugio in bunker isolati in cui la vita è organizzata da regole ferree. Antonio continua a riporre fiducia nel fatto che una cura sia all'orizzonte, ma l'incontro con il botanico Diego sembra far incrinare le sue certezze.

programme.desc: 1538 Amazzonia. Un gruppo di conquistadores si avventura alla ricerca di una mitologica città costruita con l'oro. Formano così un commando di soldati che, spronati dal bisogno di fuggire dalla loro miseria in Spagna, si sono gettati in questa impresa.

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons
programme.desc: Profion, un tiranno, tenta di rovesciare un regno pacifico governato da una dura imperatrice.

Lungo la strada salverà Rose, bambina alla disperata ricerca del padre. Sempre più responsabilizzato nei suoi confronti, James si interrogherà su ciò che realmente conta nella vita.

programme.desc: Jack Carver un ex-ufficiale delle Forze Speciali si guadagna ora da vivere facendo la guida turistica. Un giorno riceve l’incarico di accompagnare Valerie, una donna interessata ad indagare su strani esperimenti che si crede avvengano al centro di un’isola al largo di un lago canadese.

programme.desc: Dramatic views of the Pacific Ocean, brightly colored colonial buildings, world-class cuisine – the capital city of Peru, Lima has a lot going for it. Milagros reveals the treasures of her home city from the diverse neighborhoods, like the upscale Miraflores to the bohemian Barranco. She also shows a side of Lima where one can enjoy fun adventures with the marine creatures.

programme.title: Costa Rica Calling
programme.desc: Genevieve's adventures in Costa Rica begin in the capital city, San José, where she marks some Costa Rican initiation rites.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.desc: In the last leg of her journey, Milagros goes to Trujillo, where she introduces the flavors of the northern region of Peru and also Marinera – the sensuous national dance. But the highlight in Trujillo are the forgotten sites like Chan Chan and Huaca del Moche, where secrets from Peru’s pre-Incan past begin to unfold.

programme.title: Costa Rica Calling

programme.sub-title: Great World Hotels Closenberg, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Moeen, a travel enthusiast, goes for a short getaway to the Closenberg Hotel in Galle, an 18th century Dutch walled town in Sri Lanka with grand colonial houses and beautiful beaches. programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex explores Yilan starting from Xing-Yuan tea farm, then visits Farmers’ Market, tries a duck delicacy. Further he visits a Museum, a Whiskey Distillery, National Centre for Traditional Arts, enjoys a high speed train ride and treks up to experience the beauty of a waterfall.

programme.desc: Costa Rica is home to nearly 30 national parks and Genevieve sets out to explore one of them, Rincón de la Vieja.

programme.title: World Heritage

programme.sub-title: Food Fact Fun New Taipei City, Taiwan
programme.desc: In New Taipei Alex explores the fish, market San Domingo fort, the Gold museum, New Taipei Yingge Ceramics Museum and at last he ends his journey with letting off a sky lantern at Jiufen village.

programme.desc: From Antoni Gaudi’s whims to hosting the 1992 Olympics, Alex finds out that Barcelona has been shaped by many different things.

programme.desc: As Aradhana’s journey in Chhattisgarh continues, she is stunned to discover the wealth of natural beauty that the state has to offer.

programme.sub-title: Kissed By The Sea Comino, Malta

programme.title: Costa Rica Calling
programme.desc: Genevieve is drawn to Costa Rica's stunning Guanacaste region for its promise of exciting aquatic adventures.

programme.title: World Spas

programme.title: Xplore India

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Valencia, the birthplace of paella, has got the bones of a metropolis and the heart of a quaint seaside town. Alex Outhwaite experiences this when she visits the strikingly futuristic City Of Arts And Sciences and then tries the local specialty, Pinxtos at a Tapas Bar and enjoys Valencia’s laidback charms at El Cabanyal Beach. She also encounters the city’s strong Catholic roots at Cathedral de Valencia, the alleged home of the Holy Grail used by Christ at the Last Supper.

programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: Stockholm, the capital and largest city of Sweden, was built on 14 Islands. This place is also sometimes referred as Venice of the north.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: This exhilarating city of castles, beer and segway rides can take you on a break that will truly leave you catching your breath.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Visit Belgrade, with Heather as she explores the city, its architecture and learns about its past by visiting historical monuments.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: Adventurer George Kourounis’ patience is tested as he encounters deadly wildlife and challenging elements while preparing to descend into Marum Volcano in the South Pacific.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: Doubt and disbelief plague the Stormhunters after an exhaustive chase through Tornado Alley. The team is forced to make an uncomfortable decision. Do they play it safe or push past their fear.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: Extreme Weather Countdown Throwing Porta Potties to the Wind
programme.desc: The world is a dangerous place, and with wild weather occurances happening every 20 seconds, it's no wonder we never have a shortage of footage to showcase here. The videos we have gathered are guarenteed to blow you away, so let's not waste anymore time and jump right into it.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: Extreme Weather Countdown When It Rains It Pours
programme.desc: Welcome to Extreme Weather Countdown, where lightning can strike and the earth can quake all in one episode.

programme.desc: No matter where you call home, these animals call it that too.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: “Angry Planet” is there as 3 storms make landfall as hurricanes in the US.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: No-one creates eco-disasters on quite the scale of the former Soviet Union. In Uzbekistan, the Aral Sea, once one of the largest freshwater lakes in the world, has seen its waters diverted, so that it has shrunk to 1/6 its previous size. In Crimea, a mountain has been carved into a james bondian submarine base. In northern Ukraine, the Chernobyl nuclear site has been reduced to a radioactive wasteland.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George returns to the “Fin Del Mundo” at the southern tip of Argentina, this time to sail on a Russian icebreaker to Antarctica. After braving the stormy Drake passage, he explores volcanic Deception Island, camps out in the Antarctic snow, and paddles a kayak through icebergs calved off the melting glaciers.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Filming the volcanoes, mudpools and geysers in the geothermic wonderland of New Zealand’s north island, we learn that a new island is being created by an undersea volcano 1000 miles north in Tonga. Determined to be among the first to see this “newest land on earth”, we head for the remote island by plane and boat, after various nautical mishaps, George ends up, bedraggled and clad in nothing but underwear and a lifejacket, honored to be one of the very first to explore this brand new island.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We break the bounds of earth, and look at the environment of space. We examine the difficulties and challenges of exploring this most challenging environment.↵ ↵George experiences some of the extreme training needed for space travel –aboard a Czech-built Albatross fighter jet, the Zero-G plane, and a centrifuge producing 6 G’s of force, and witnesses the launch of a flight to the International Space Station.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: In 2000, a remarkable find was made in Chihuahua, Mexico, of a spectacular cave filled with giant crystals, some over 20 meters long. But it is a intensely difficult spot to explore – with temperatures over 50 degrees C and humidity well over 100%. George leads an Explorers Club Flag Expedition into the cave, wearing special refrigerated suits and respirators to battle the extreme environment.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The “Angry Planet” team hopes to film the natural wonders and extreme phenomena of this fascinating Central Asian country, including a spectacularly burning crater of natural gas, underground lakes, sandstorms and remnants of the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: For George Kourounis‚ ground zero for stormchasing is Oklahoma City, the capital of´Tornado Alley´.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The Angry Planet team heads to Africa to climb the steep and very active Nyiragongo Volcano in the Congo that erupted in 2002, sending 125,000 people fleeing for their lives. Host/adventurer George Kourounis explores the bubbling lake of molten lava and investigates the risk the dangerous volcano poses to both the people of city of Goma and the Mountain Gorillas who live on the nearby jungle slopes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: Angry Planet The Winds of Autumn
programme.desc: The autumn of 2006 brings hurricanes to the North Atlantic and hot dry winds fan forest fires across Northern Ontario. Host/adventurer George Kourounis has traveled to some awesome hurricanes, including Rita and Katrina, with his pal Mark Robinson. This year they stormchase in Newfoundland, site of the hurricane that pulled Mark out of a life-threatening depression.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Host George Kourounis has braved many terrifying phenomena – but none as frightening as the one he takes on in this episode: marriage! To make sure his new bride is on the same adventurous page with him, he proposes to get married on the lip of an exploding volcano, on the South Pacific island of Tanna, in Vanuatu. Before the native preacher, dressed in grass skirt and kustom garb, gets to perform the smoky vows, George descends into the erupting volcano to bring out red hot samples of the lava it is producing.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Avalanche danger is very high in the Rogers Pass area of the Trans Canada Highway in British Columbia. Host of Angry Planet George Kourounis travels with a variety of experts to bring down huge avalanches in the Rocky Mountains. Ski Patrollers throw hand charges to clear the slopes, the British Columbia Department of Highways uses helicopter bombing and mountaintop mortars to keep the roads safe, and the Canadian Armed Forces fire 105mm howitzers at the mountains to bring down the dangerous snow. Still, there are accidents and fatalities in the mountains. We meet Francois Desroisers, an avalanche burial victim who tells a terrible and tragic tale of a mountain disaster.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Some of the fiercest weather can be experienced at the area the South Americans call the “Fin del Mundo”.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George returns to “Tornado Alley” with 3 fellow stormchasers to see what the 2007 Storm Season will bring.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We hope Season Two will give us the opportunity to make the quintessential Angry Planet show – a full episode exploring a major hurricane that makes landfall in Florida or the Carolinas.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: Storm Hunters Height of Ruin - Part 2
programme.desc: While in Nepal, the Stormhunters receive unexpected news that literally takes this trip to the next level. They contend with mountainous terrain, adverse weather and altitude sickness in their quest to glimpse Earth's highest mountain.

programme.title: Storm Hunters

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: It’s an ordinary town with a history of heartache. No one knows why Moore, Oklahoma has been the target of 3 mega-tornadoes in just 16 years. programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: They're no strangers to nature’s extremes but Hurricanes Harvey and Irma test the Stormhunters.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: Storm Hunters Height of Ruin - Part 1
programme.desc: George joins Mark and Jaclyn on a journey to Nepal.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Host/adventurer George Kourounis explores the American Southwest during the Desert Monsoon. He ups the danger factor by traveling with wild atheist shock-jock R.J. Evans to track massive lightning storms which can produce bolts of up to one hundred million volts. The pair come close - too close - to dangerous electrical clouds swirling over Tucson, Sedona and Monument Valley.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: With summer wildfires overpowering the Yukon forests, host/adventurer George Kourounis follows the fabled route of the Klondike Gold Rush sourdoughs through the bawdy town of Skagway, Alaska, paddling the white water rivers and the White Horse Rapids into the Yukon. He travels on mountain bike, steam train and Cessna to experience the huge fires and meet the northern fire crews battling the blazes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George tracks twisters through the Tornado Alley and descends into the Erte Ale Volcano.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George investigates the wild side of water in dangerous class 5 river rapids.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Mount Washington, New Hampshire has the dubious title of being home to the world’s worst weather. The highest wind ever recorded on the planet – 231 miles per hour – was recorded at its mountaintop observatory. To prepare for a mid-winter assault on the summit, Angry Planet host George Kourounis becomes a “human popsicle”, encased in ice in at the National Resarch Council’s high speed wind tunnel. Then he and his sidekick Mark Robinson climb to the top of the mountain in mid-January and brave their way into a summit blizzard.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Dominica, the most volcanic and mountainous island in the Caribbean, is home to the Boiling Lake, a large waterfall-fed lake of furiously boiling water. Adventurer George Kourounis becomes the first person ever to traverse across the lake on a rope, risking his life to take water samples and shoot video from a place no human has ever been. He then dives to the ocean floor off the coast of the island to explore vents where the superheated water bubbles into the ocean.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.
